contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox Film | name = Jesus Christ Vampire Hunter | image = Jesus Christ Vampire Hunter.jpg | director = [[Lee Demarbre]] | writer = [[Ian Driscoll]] | starring = [[Phil Caracas]] <br /> [[Murielle Varhelyi]] <br /> [[Jeff Moffet]] <br /> [[Ian Driscoll]] <br /> [[Nicholas Edwards (actor)|Nicholas Edwards]] | music = [[Graham Collins]] | editing = [[Lee Demarbre]] | distributor = [[Odessa Filmworks|Odessa Filmworks, Inc.]] | released = {{film date|df=yes|2001|06|10|premiere|2002|1|15|Canada}} | runtime = 85 minutes | language = English | budget = $100,000 [[Canadian dollar|CAD]] }} '''''Jesus Christ Vampire Hunter''''' is a 2001 [[cult film]] from [[Odessa Filmworks]] which deals with [[Jesus]]' modern-day struggle to protect the [[lesbian]]s of [[Ottawa]], [[Ontario]], [[Canada]], from [[vampire]]s with the help of [[Lucha libre|Mexican wrestler]] El Santo (based on [[Santo|El Santo, Enmascarado de Plata]], and played by actor Jeff Moffet, who starred as El Santo in two other Odessa Filmworks productions). This film earned an honorable mention in the Spirit of Slamdance category at the 2002 [[Slamdance Film Festival]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://slamdance.com/2002/festival/ |title=Slamdance 2002 Film Festival |date= January 11â€“19, 2002 |work=Slamdance 2002 |archiveurl= http://web.archive.org/web/20030720030643/http://slamdance.com/2002/festival/ |archivedate= 20 July 2003}}</ref> ==Plot== The movie begins with Jesus Christ sitting on a beach relaxing and comparing the kingdom of God to a sand castle. He meets up with El Santo and a woman named Mary Magnum. Together they fight lesbian-killing vampires. Jesus fights with [[mixed martial arts]] skills and uses his [[carpentry]] skills to create weapons to slay vampires. ==Reception== ''[[Time (magazine)|Time]]'''s [[Richard Corliss]] panned the film, finding that "the comedy is slack, the song lyrics feeble, the pace torpid".<ref>{{cite news | url=http://www.time.com/time/columnist/corliss/article/0,9565,596076,00.html | title=Jesus Christ Movie Star | publisher=''[[Time (magazine)|Time]]'' | accessdate=2008-01-19 | first=Richard | last=Corliss | date=29 February 2004 | accessdate=14 October 2010 }}</ref> Ken Eisner of ''[[Variety (magazine)|Variety]]'' took a more neutral view, finding that "the film is too silly to offend".<ref>{{cite news | url=http://www.variety.com/review/VE1117917701.html?categoryid=31&cs=1&p=0 | title=Review: ''Jesus Christ Vampire Hunter'' | publisher=''[[Variety (magazine)|Variety]]'' | first=Ken | last=Eisner | date=10 May 2002 | accessdate=2008-01-19 }}</ref> Jason Nolan of ''The Harrow'' deemed the production "horridly wonderful" although uneven, noting that "[w]ith a film like this, you want it to be bumpy".<ref>{{cite news | url=http://www.theharrow.com/columns/reviews/jesusvampire.html | publisher=''[[The Harrow]]'' | accessdate=2008-01-29 | year=2004 | first=Jason | last=Nolan | title=Jesus Christ, Vampire Hunter (review) }}</ref> Film Threat's Eric Campos gave the film a generally positive review.<ref>{{cite news | url=http://www.filmthreat.com/index.php?section=reviews&Id=3134 | publisher=''[[Film Threat]]'' | title= Jesus Christ Vampire Hunter (review) | first=Eric | last=Campos | accessdate=14 October 2010 }} {{rating|4|4}}</ref> ==See also== *''[[Abraham Lincoln: Vampire Hunter (film)|Abraham Lincoln: Vampire Hunter]]'', and its [[The Asylum|Asylum]] mockbuster, ''[[Abraham Lincoln vs. Zombies]]'' *''[[Hansel and Gretel: Witch Hunters]]'', and its [[The Asylum|Asylum]] mockbuster, ''[[Hansel & Gretel (2013 film)|Hansel & Gretel]]'' *''[[Queen Victoria: Demon Hunter]]'' ==References== {{reflist}} ==External links== *[http://www.odessafilmworks.com/jcvh/index.html Odessa Filmworks: ''Jesus Christ Vampire Hunter''] * {{IMDb title|0311361|Jesus Christ Vampire Hunter}} * {{Amg movie|274955|Jesus Christ Vampire Hunter}} * {{rotten-tomatoes|id=jesus_christ_vampire_hunter|title=Jesus Christ Vampire Hunter}} * [http://www.cesnur.org/2002/dracula/08.htm CESNUR: "Scholars at the American Academy of Religion Discuss ''Jesus Christ, Vampire Hunter''"] * [http://www.foodisnotlove.podomatic.com/ ''Food is not Love'' Interview with Director Lee Demarbre On Episode Titled "Bonded by Blood"] <!-- Please do not remove the 3 primary film categories -Year, Country, Language --> <!-- end of primary film categories --> {{Use dmy dates|date=October 2010}} [[Category:2000s comedy horror films]] [[Category:2001 films]] [[Category:Canadian comedy films]]
